page.title: 14Employment in Aston
page.content: In the area of the survey aproximately 78% of men were employed. Most of the jobs were skilled and only 29 men had unskilled jobs. Some were managerial and a few were professional. The most popular jobs for men were electrician and joiner but surprisingly enough only five were connected in any way with steel, although six years ago the figures would have been different. The most popular places for employment were Sheffield and Rotherham but some men were employed as far away as York or North Yorkshire. Approximately 52% of the women are employed, but bear it in mind that some women might not want jobs because they have children to look after, and some are housewives. Most women work locally and most women seem to think their jobs are unskilled.
